{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2960].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , new Customer user will only assign to Service Desk Customer role , which only have access to Customer Portal . As admin , would like to have an option to allow Customer user auto assign to JIRA Internal User group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give option to allow Customer user auto assign to JIRA Internal User group for Service Desk configuration.
fields.summary: As admin, would like to have option to auto assign Customer user to JIRA Internal user group

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2959].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As a JIRA Service Desk Administrator, I would like to be able to set up my Service Desk to auto assign tickets in a Round Robin fashion. This would be extremely helpful if it offered several different ways to have auto-assignment handled 

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server

h3. Steps to Enable
# Open project settings
# Click on a menu option in the left hand menu (perhaps Auto Assignment?)
# Select the type of auto assignment you want to enable within the Service Desk project

h3. Actual Results
Currently there is no option to do this within Service Desk
 
h3. Notes
This feature would add more value if it allowed at minimum these two types of round robin assignment:

- Assignment based on number of issues each Service Desk Agent currently has
- Assignment based on all Service Desk Agents that are part of the Service Desk queue (this would not take into consideration backlog per agent rather it would just simply go down the list and assign tickets)
fields.summary: Automatically round robin assign Service Desk requests

Adding participant triggers email notification to the user who has been added. Removing and adding participant triggers unnecessary email notifications.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It looks like most of the [JIRA Desk Server Migration Hub Links |https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver030/jira-service-desk-documentation-761768528.html]  are linking to cloud articles. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Start at [JIRA Server Desk Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-documentation-408453917.html]
# Click Latest Documentation under JIRA Server Desk Server
# The following links direct you to cloud articles:

*ALL* Links under:
- Getting Started
- Administering Service Desk

*Specific links*:
- Serving your customers "Creating Service Level Agreements": https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/example-creating-a-basic-sla-732528982.html
- Integrations "Connecting to a knowledge base": https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html

h3. Expected Results
They should be directing to the appropriate JIRA Service Desk Server articles. 
h3. Actual Results
Directing you to cloud articles.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Server Documentation linking to cloud.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2945].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Service Desk , only SLA based reporting can be created directly from Service Desk reporting feature . As an admin, would like to create customise report and auto populated graph. Below is few of example of reporting and graph :-
# Average time to resolve for entire service desk
# Number of tickets resolved by service desk / 2nd-3rd line / per team    per week
# Age of open calls
# Calls opened vs calls closed each day / week / month\
# Average rating per agent

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide customization reporting and auto populated graph from Service Desk reporting

h3. Workaround 
Use [JIRA Charting Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting] or [eazyBI JIRA reports and charts plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.eazybi.jira.plugins.eazybi-jira/server/overview]
fields.summary: As admin, would like to create customise report and graph

It would be great to choose per project if i want to use:

The [Time Tracking Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/time-tracking-report-185729564.html] enables us to track time for issues. Currently this is not available for Service Desk Projects but is included in Software and Business Projects only.

h3. Summary
Click the "Comment internally" button and the Reporter (even if not an Agent) receives the comment via email. This is unexpected behavior.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create ticket with someone that is not an agent
# Create internal comment
# Reporter gets email even though he/she is not an agent

h3. Expected Results
Comment should stay internal and not send to anyone that is not an agent

h3. Actual Results
No agent gets notification

h3.Workaround
No workaround known of

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2934].
  {panel}

The custom field _request participants_ has the same functionality like Cc in emails.

In our service desk configuration we have some request types where the customer needs to enter their direct manager (e.g. extend file server permissions, get a license for a commercial software, ...).

Due to the restriction that only _agents_ can comment to the customer (reporter) a default JIRA user picker will not work in this scenario. Every other user than agents also request participants can only write internal comments if the comment is not written via the customer portal.

Also the manager will not see the requests of his team within his customer portal.

Additional add a permission type for this field so that it can be used in issue security levels or notification schemes.
fields.summary: Ability to create your own custom field from the same type as request participants

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2933].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
The inability to capture a users organization during the self-service user sign-up process for Jira Service Desk makes it hard to identify which organizations are generating support requests.

*Requested Behaviour*
Add a field for a user to specify their organization name as well as their name and email address when they sign up for a Service Desk customer account and is editable by administrators.
fields.summary: Ability to add a custom field such as Customer's Organization in Service Desk customer portal profile

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When loading the 'SLA goals' page, it takes a very long time to load and in certain situations the AJAX timeout may kick in and prevent the page from properly loading. This appears as per the attached screenshot - no data is populated.

h3. Environment

This was reproduced on Oracle 11g, however could also occur on MS SQL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a SLA with a decent number of goals - this was repro'd with 80.
# Access the SLA tab.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads quickly, retrieving the appropriate results.

h3. Actual Results

The page takes a significant amount of time to load, and in some cases may fail to load altogether as the AJAX timeout kicks in (this is 1 minute).

h3. Workaround

Increasing the timeout may allow the page to eventually load - this can be done with the following:

# Open [Chrome Developer Tools|https://developers.google.com/chrome-developer-tools/docs/overview#access], select the console and enter the below (this sets a timeout of 10 minutes):
{code}
jQuery.ajaxSetup({timeout:600000});
{code}
# Click on the SLA tab (open it in the same window, not a new one).
# The page should eventually populate, after the SQL has finished executing and the results are returned.

(i) This workaround will only apply to the window that argument is set in - there's not an easy way to apply it to the entire instance.

h3. Notes

This is caused by a bug in the Active Objects library, which is tracked in [AO-565|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AO-565]. Upgrading to JIRA 7 or higher will fix this problem, as it contains the fixed version of the Active Objects library.
fields.summary: The SLA goals screen takes a long time to load and may not appear at all

If this problem persists, try the "Clear server settings" button below.

Report problem with Atlassian (remember to include the support information below).

URL: https://football.atlassian.net/rest/bonfire/1.0/issue-attach?issueKey=FB-11937
Request method: POST
Status code: 504
Status message: OK
Error key: error.rest.defaultCapture for JIRA version (server): 2.9.7.0034Capture for JIRA version (browser): 2.9.6.0Capture for JIRA details: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/46.0.2490.80 Safari/537.36
Platform: Win32
-----Capture for JIRA Plugin Properties
version: 2.9.7.0034
buildDate: 2015-10-26T00:00:00.000-07:00
buildNumber: 
licenceStatus: activated
jiraVersion: 7.0.0-OD-08-005
jiraBuildInfo: 7.0.0-OD-08-005#70107-sha1:5fb2f7e0c016d05ff672e1e32fcd963de6cf92ae

fields.description:
The JIRA.Events.ISSUE_REFRESHED event should be fired whenever an issue is modified.

I'm seeing an inconsistency between viewing an issue in JIRA (i.e. /jira/browse/TEST-1) and in a Service Desk queue (i.e. /jira/projects/TEST/queues/1/TEST-1). In the former case, when I unassign an issue I get a JIRA.Events.ISSUE_REFRESHED fired, but in the latter case that event doesn't seem to be fired.
fields.summary: JIRA.Events.ISSUE_REFRESHED not fired when issue unassigned in Queue view

Hello team,

My SLA times are frozen even when it is within business hours I have pre-defined in the calendar. Please see attached for two screenshots. You can see my desktop time showing it is well within my SLA of "9-5 PM Business hours". This did not occur before, but only recently (possible past couple weeks). However, when I place "In progress" usually the clock will become unstuck. 

My System default is (GMT-05:00) New York, which is correct. 

Tickets affected:
- https://heatit.atlassian.net/browse/MHSD-299 (This one is still stuck)
- https://heatit.atlassian.net/browse/MHSD-169 (I moved into "In Progress" and now it works)

I have also attached my SLAs

At the moment, only Agents can generate reports from within JIRA

h3. Problem Definition
When there's a problem with incoming mail due to certain error , incoming mail will stop . But , service desk email still flooded with email . Once , the problem solved , all emails created issue tickets . Eventhough , the email is from few days back , which issue creation no longer needed . If admin able to configure amount of time , whatever email created before the current time minus amount of time configured , issue ticket won't be created.
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Give admin an option to configure amount of time limit for issue creation from email .

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There are some warning message in log file regarding Service Desk Automation even if there is no automation rule was set. The error message is not good enough to narrow down to any root cause of the warning message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Installed Service Desk.
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Delete all the automation rule.
# Observe the atlassian-jira.log for the warning message with error message; "ErrorMessage@b16ceeed".
# To check if there is any automation rule that is active, you can run the following SQL:
{noformat}
select * from "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET";
{noformat}
Sample output for no active automation rule:
{noformat}
-[ RECORD 1 ]------+--
ACTIVE_REVISION_ID |
ID                 | 1
-[ RECORD 2 ]------+--
ACTIVE_REVISION_ID |
ID                 | 2
{noformat}
Sample output for an active automation rule:
{noformat}
-[ RECORD 1 ]------+--
ACTIVE_REVISION_ID |
ID                 | 1
-[ RECORD 2 ]------+--
ACTIVE_REVISION_ID |
ID                 | 2
-[ RECORD 3 ]------+--
ACTIVE_REVISION_ID | 3
ID                 | 3
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
* No warning message regarding automation rule since there is no automation rules set in Service Desk. 
* Have a proper error message for the warning instead of "ErrorMessage@b16ceeed".

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2015-11-03 14:11:59,706 http-bio-8081-exec-19 WARN xxx 851x69978x1 xxxx xx.xxx.xx.xxx /rest/api/2/issue/13533/comment [execution.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error com.atlassian.pocketknife.api.commons.error.ErrorMessage@b16ceeed
2015-11-03 14:20:43,426 http-bio-8081-exec-16 WARN xxx 860x70162x1 xxxx xx.xxx.xx.xxx /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [execution.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error com.atlassian.pocketknife.api.commons.error.ErrorMessage@b16ceeed
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* There is no degradation in any Service Desk functionality even with the warning message.
fields.summary: Getting warning message in logs with error message ErrorMessage@b16ceeed

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2641].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When installing/upgrading Service Desk, it might auto create several configurations such as Field Configuration, Field Config Scheme, etc. However, there will be times where the upgrade failed after some of these configurations are created. These created configurations could then cause confusion and even errors in the system.

h3. Suggestion
Handle these failed install/upgrade tasks better, perhaps by auto removing any created configurations.
fields.summary: Better handling of failed installation/upgrade

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 7, the _Help Center_ is no longer displaying separate Service Desk description. Instead, it's showing the recent _Request Type_ and the list of SD projects on the left side.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have an option to show each of the Service Desk description on Help Center.
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to show the separate SD description in Help Center

  {panel}

Dear Support 

I recently tried to install the following 3rd party add-on
"Gannt Cloud" by WISOFT:
https://wisoft.atlassian.net/wiki/display/GanttOnDemand/Working+with+Gantt+charts
 
Our Jira could instance is: https://praekelt.atlassian.net


Steps to replicate:
--------------------------
I went to our JIRA Cloud instance and went to the Atlassian Market place page (/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/search?q=gantt)
I then clicked on the free trial button for Gantt Cloud and a pop up appeared.
I clicked the "Accept & Install" button.
The installation seemed to run but then I got the following error on the screen:
"Could not install add-on "Gantt Cloud" because it requires administrator privileges and atlassian-addons-admin group does not have the JIRA administrator global permission."
 
I then tried to remedy this by going to the Global Permissions in our JIRA cloud system and adding the Atlassian-add-on-admin to the "Browse Users" group  here:
/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa
>> This did not seem to help as I still get this same error when trying to install the "Gantt Cloud" 3rd party plugin.
 
There seem to be these 2 tickets I found on the matter:
AC-1014
AC-1238
Are these above still an issue?
 
Please can you assist me in trying to install this plugin and let me know if there is something that I need to do.

>> Please see the Answers response I got from the Atlassian client support (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/32022670/answers/32022850)
 
Thanks
Sean
fields.summary: Gannt Cloud Add on by WISOFT installation error message

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2638].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer is not allowed to edit notification email settings at their profile in Customer Portal . Only JIRA Service Desk admin are allow to change it from JIRA . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer should allow to edit their own email notifications settings from the customer portal.
fields.summary: As a customer, should allow to edit notification email settings from customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2520].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When setting up an automation rule using {{request-channel-type = portal/email}} as a condition, it does not work.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a _Custom Rule_ automation
# _WHEN_: Issue Created
# _IF_: Issue matches -> Advanced -> {{request-channel-type = email/portal}}
# _THEN_: Add comment (key in any text as a comment), _Comment Type_: Internal/Public
# Create a new issue either from _Customer Portal_ or by sending an email

h3. Expected Result
Comment is added on the newly created issue

h3. Actual Result
No comment is added
fields.summary: Automation rule using request-channel-type as a condition does not work

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2519].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently to set up email creation using an email account, an admin must use the POP3 or IMAP settings of an Exchange server, and not Exchange itself

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide support for Exchange email
 
h3. Workaround 
Continue to use IMAP or POP3 Exchange server settings
fields.summary: As an administrator, provide the ability to set up issue creation from email using an Exchange account

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2518].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
A ticket can go through multiple cycles of the same SLA. The SLA web panel will then show whether this ticket met or breaches the SLA for each individual cycle
!1.png! 

However, there isn't any reporting capabilities for this information. The default SLA report will only show whether the *latest* is met or breached.

h3. Suggestion
Create a report for this information where users can see exactly how many *cycles* of SLA are met or breached based on a JQL query
fields.summary: Additional reporting for same ticket with multiple SLA cycles

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2517].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
All the information can be found in the Service Desk mail log. Service Desk Mail log requires user to constantly monitor the log to see if a ticket has failed or not. It would be great to receive a notification like how JIRA does.

* JIRA Email handling error:
!image.png!
fields.summary: Notification for when an email is failed to processed or rejected for Service Desk project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2511].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently to create a Service Desk, you must do it one at a time.

h3. Suggested Solution
For admins that need multiple Service Desks with the same settings, it would be nice to either:
# Duplicate existing Service Desks
# Create multiple Service Desks at one time using same settings, i.e. Bulk Create Service Desks
fields.summary: As an admin, allow duplication or bulk creation of Service Desks

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2510].
  {panel}

At the moment the system only suggest articles if the customer is searching for something or if he is opening an issue. I think it would be very nice if the customer could click through all articles and read them. 

So it would be nice if service desk show some categories under the request items on the customer portal. 

I saw this at a support portal here: http://supportuk.sumup.com (see screenshot)

There are all catogories and the top 5 articles of the category. 

Another nice feature is a comment function on articles. The articles would be more integrated than just open a popup.
fields.summary: Make KB articles more integrated into Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add categorization to automation rules

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2508].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, if you are an SD Agent, you can click on the project and see the *Customer Portal* link in the side bar. If you are part of the SD Team, you can also do the same to access the Customer Portal.

However, if you are just a Service Desk Customer (but have access to either Core or Software), there is no links which will allow you to access the Customer Portal when you are logged in to JIRA. You will have to remember the URL of the Portal and manually type it in to access it

h3. Suggestion
Have a page to list the portals which this user is allowed to access only as a customer.
fields.summary: Customer Portal links in JIRA for SD Customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2507].
  {panel}

I'm attaching 2 screenshots. One is showing the current functionality found in JIRA Software Issue Navigator, where by clicking in a column title, the content is sorted out by that column. If the column is clicked again, the sorting order is reverted in the same column. I propose a similar functionality in JIRA SD.

Problem Definition
Not able to sort columns by clicking on it on JIRA Service Desk

Suggested Solution
Do as on JIRA Issue navigator where you can click on columns and sort the issues by the column, click again and reverse the order.
 
Workaround 
The only available workaround is to choose the columns you want to be the key to sort the list of issues on Service Service, although you have to edit it, not only click like on JIRA Navigator
fields.summary: Sort list of issues by clicking on the column on Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Allow Pre-populated Commenting to be Configured Instance Wide

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Request form page at Customer Portal doesn't load on top of the page when the form size longer than the browser. It didn't works to certain browser , but it works for Chrome. 

h3. Environment
* IE 11
* Firefox 45

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add more than 15 fields and additional 1 *Multiple Line* custom fields to Customer Portal request type .
# Access customer portal , and raise a request .

h3. Expected Results
Request form page load from the top of the page with all type of fields.

h3. Actual Results
Request form page doesn't load from the top of the page when have *Multiple Line* custom fields added.
 !Top-Form-Missing.gif|width=500! 
 

h3.Workaround
Use Chrome browser.
fields.summary: Request form page at Customer Portal doesn't load on top the page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2503].
  {panel}

Installing JIRA Service Desk Add-on on JIRA 6.4.12 changes the behavior of the [Checklist Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.okapya.jira.checklist].

Service Desk seems to enable "Save on blur" for the Checklist Customfield. This custom field cannot work with the normal Blur Trigger as items such as menus are created outside of the DOM for the Checklist Field.

Projects not under Service Desk are not affected by this.

This is extremely problematic as it causes important lost of functionality for the Checklist Add-on.

*Steps to reproduce*

* Install  [Checklist Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.okapya.jira.checklist]
* Create Checklist Customfield, add options and add it to a Service Desk project screen
* From Service Desk, select an issue
* Enter inline editing for the Checklist directly in the Issue Details View
* Modify the Checklist by adding items
* Select top right gear menu on the Checklist Header
* Select "Check all items"
* Checklist will start a "save on blur" and will not properly commit the changes. (Checklist did not enable "Save on blur" since it has elements such as menu which resides outside the customfield DOM. However Service Desk seemed to have enabled the behavior).
* Redo from step 3 but click on the issue Edit button.
* Close Edit dialog
* Checklist has now lost its "save of blur" trigger.
fields.summary: Service Desk Add-on changes behavior of Checklist add-on

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2501].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk does not allow certain ticket priorities to be hidden from specific customers. All ticket priorities are available to all customers within JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA Service Desk Administrators to specify which customers can see specific priorities. The use case here is that certain customers pay for different levels of service and thus the providing company wants to be able to tier their priorities based on this.
fields.summary: Allow certain priorities to be hidden based on customer in Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2500].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users are able to sort issue (Ascending / descending) by just clicking the column name on _Issue Navigator_. It would be great to have this feature available in Service Desk Queue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to sort the issues on Service Desk Queue by clicking the column name.
fields.summary: Ability to sort issues by clicking the column name

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
Translated resolutions are not displayed in the Customer Portal.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Translate all resolutions to other language, let's say Spanish.
# Change the system language to Spanish.
# View the ticket in Customer Portal.

h3. Expected result
Every detail in the Customer Portal is displayed in Spanish

h3. Actual result
Every detail in the Customer Portal is displayed in Spanish, except the Resolution which is still displayed in English
fields.summary: Resolution Translations are not applied to customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2493].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Issue Creation and add Participant Notification will contain the Description of the request in the Email Subject. But for Issue Updated Notification, the Description is not included in the Email Subject. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Description of the request should be reflected in the subject line of all Notification
fields.summary: Description of the request should be reflected in the subject line of all Notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2492].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+

As a JIRA Service Desk administrator, I'd like to allow customers to log in through the JIRA login page. Currently, if I have JIRA hosted at *jira.example.com*, I'll need to direct customers to *jira.example.com/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals* so they can log in. 

h4. +Suggestion+

Allow customers to log in from the login gadget or main login page, and automatically redirect them to the *Customer Portal*.
fields.summary: Allow Customers to Log in through JIRA regular Login pages

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2491].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 

Having Connectivity and Processing Logs only to be observed at UI makes it difficult for support team to check them.
Also it is strange for customer to provide screenshot of logs along with attaching support.zip

h3. Suggested Solution 
Per JSD-2412, Service Desk needs to create incoming mail log file even if there is no mail handler in JIRA core along with Connectivity and Processing logs.
fields.summary: Create And Include Connectivity and Processing Logs In Support.zip

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2488].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

This is Charlie from the Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center team. We’re excited to let you know that we’re starting work on this suggestion. While we don’t have a concrete timeline on the delivery, we hope to roll it out soon and will update the status here when we have additional details.

Kind regards,

Charlie
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When there are multiple Service Desk projects, the Service Desk portals overview, eg. https://<instance name>/servicedesk/customer/portals, will display a *Search bar*.
 It is currently not possible to remove the search bar.

!search_bar.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to remove the search bar in the Service Desk portals overview
fields.summary: Option to remove the Search Bar in the Service Desk portals overview.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Allow Releases/Version panel to be displayed in SD project type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2442].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When uploading a specific logo, with a specific colour, JIRA Service Desk modifies the colour somewhat in the conversion to a BASE64 Image. 

See the attached sample image.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option for an 'as-is' image, so that no modification to the image is made when uploading it.

h3. Workaround
None recorded.
fields.summary: Provide an 'AS IS' logo option for Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using some image types causes Service Desk to fail silently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the Service Desk Portal
# Edit the Portal
# Attempt to use a light logo with opacity. 

h3. Expected Results
# JIRA Service Desk should accept this image as a logo if it is a valid image.
# JIRA Should show an error if it can not accept the image for whatever reason.

h3. Actual Results
# JIRA Service Desk accepts the image, but fails silently to save the image as a logo for the Service Desk
# The Image can not be uploaded to be the Service Desk Logo.
fields.summary: Unable to upload some images as logos for Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2437].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Comment Required Validator no longer reporting error when comment is not added upon resolving issue

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-002 with JIRA Service Desk 3.1.0-OD-01-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA MISC Workflow Extension
# Configured *Comment Required Validator* at Service Desk project workflow for one of the transition.
# Test the transition without comment . Customised error doesn't pop up.

h3. Expected Results
Test the transition without comment . Customised error will pop up.
h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2434].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA user with a space in the username. (e.g test test)
# Create a Service Desk ticket in the Customer portal
# Click on Add people in the portal and add the JIRA user that you've just created. (test test)

h3. Expected Behaviour:
JIRA user is added as a participant

h3. Actual Behaviour:
Throws Error "*User cannot be found*".
!image.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround:
Edit and remove the space in the username.
fields.summary: JIRA User can't be added as a participant in Service Desk customer portal if there's space in the username

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2428].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The *Request Participant* Field When added to the create issue Screen does not populate on the screen

h3. Environment
* (Cloud) JIRA Service Desk v3.0.0-OD-04-002-D20150924T014602
* (Cloud) JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.663.0
* JIRA v1000.571.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Request Participant* to the Create issue Screen on Service Desk Project
# Logged in as an agent, select Create issue

h3. Expected Results
Request Participant Field is present on Create issue Screen

h3. Actual Results
- *Request Participant* Field acts like a hidden field
- *Wheres My Field?* Helper indicates the field is present on the screen

h3.Workaround
- Set *Request Participant* to the edit issue Screen
- Create issue without a *Request Participant* 
- Edit issue and add in a *Request Participant* value

h3. Notes:
The same thing also happens for the *Organization* field.
fields.summary: Request Participant Missing from Create issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2424].
  {panel}

One of our customers contacted me with questions about Service Desk, starting with "how can I find it? is it gone?"
It was supposed to be findable in UPM, if not in marketplace.atlassian.com, but it is not.
I found it with google, but that's not what customers are expected to do, are they?

They also found documentation claiming that Service Desk requires the same user tier as base JIRA - I hope it only means they found the 1.0 documentation, not that this is what 3.0 is doing
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk unavailable for JIRA 6.x customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2423].
  {panel}

Currently it is possible to navigate from JIRA to the portal, but not from the portal back to JIRA. This suggestion is to add a way for a customer with a JIRA license to navigate from the portal to the JIRA interface.
* JIRA interface refers to JIRA Core, JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk when viewing the project through the JIRA project view.

h5. Example Use Case:
As a user of JIRA Software as well as JIRA Service Desk. I frequently find myself moving between these two applications. I would like an easy way to navigate between the customer portal and the JIRA interface.
* Currently there is no navigation from the portal back to JIRA. I find myself going to the URL and removing the Service Desk portion so that I am taken back to JIRA. 
* When working in JIRA Software, I must enter the URL for the Service Desk portal in order to access the portal and create a request. There is no navigation I can use to access the portal. (A workaround is provided below)

h5. Navigating from JIRA to Customer Portal
* The Service Desk menu at the top of the JIRA can be used to navigate to the portal (Service Desk > Create Service Desk Request)
* This menu was removed in JIRA 7. You can use [Application Navigator | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-links-in-the-application-navigator-346948276.html] to link to the customer portal URL. JIRA users can then use the application navigator to reach the Service Desk portal.
fields.summary: Provide easier way to navigate from customer portal to JIRA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The URL contains the JIRA issue key when viewing a request in the customer portal. The project key portion of the issue key is case sensitive. This is not so in JIRA Core or JIRA Software. 

This can be reproduced by viewing an issue in the customer portal and then changing the case of one or more letters in the project key. 
* A message appears: "Cannot find issue"
fields.summary: Project key in portal URL is case senstive

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2421].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA 7, it is no longer possible to see _Development Tools_ section for SD project type. Users need to either convert to Software project or create a new one as mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/cloud_jira+agile+jsd_post-update-checklist#Cloud_JIRA+Agile+JSD_Post-updatechecklist-4.Re-configureyoursoftwareandservicedeskprojects(ifneeded)].

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow development tools to be shown in SD project type if users have both application access (JIRA Software and JIRA SD).
fields.summary: Allow development tools to be shown in SD project type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Scenario
1. Create an issue in JIRA directly, but don't fill in a Customer Request Type
2. Edit the issue and update the Customer Request Type

h5. Expected behaviour
In step 2 an Issue Event with event type id 2 (update) should be fired.

h5. Actual behaviour
No event is fired.
This means that plugins do not have a way to respond to changes made to the 'Customer Request Type' field.
fields.summary: Updating the Customer Request Type does not fire an Issue Event

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Scenario
1. Disable inline editing in JIRA's System Settings.
 !system_settings.png|thumbnail! 
2. In the Service Desk menu, click on a service desk, so you get to see the Queues screen.
3. Click on an issue.

h5. Expected behaviour
The issue should not be editable inline because this is disabled in JIRA's system settings.

h5. Actual behaviour
The fields of the issue are editable inline.
E.g. the description field:
 !Inline edit 1.png|thumbnail!

E.g. the priority field: 
 !Inline edit 2.png|thumbnail! 

There are several reasons why we want to disable inline editing:
- We want to limit the number of notifications customers receive. In an edit dialog, users are more likely to update all fields at once.
- Some plugins can add custom fields that depend on each other (E.g. Kepler Database Custom Field supports child fields). These work well in an edit dialog, but not so well when editable inline.
fields.summary: Service Desk "Queues" screen does not respect JIRA's "Inline Edit" System setting

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2418].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Service Desk Request
# Make Agent1 to recieve issue commented notifications (make him a watcher, or smth that mathes your Notification Scheme)
# Collaborator or another Agent2 writes an internal comment -> Agent1 recieves notification (/)
# Now add Agent1 to "Request Participiants"
# Collaborator or another Agent2 writes an internal comment again -> Agent1 *does not* recieve notification (x)
fields.summary: Agent does not recieve internal comments notifications if he's mentioned in Request Participiants

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am adding a comment to a ticket that was created during evaluation system setup.
http://localhost:8080/projects/IT/queues/1/IT-1 if it matters.

When I hover the "Share with customer" and "Comment internally" buttons I see a tooltip suggesting the same Ctrl-Alt-s shortcut for both buttons.
The Cancel button says "Press Ctrl-Alt-` to submit the form" - I'd rather not submit with Cancel button ;-)

BTW - 3.0.0 is in "Unreleased versions" in the Affects Versions field below - I believe it has been released as I managed to download it.
fields.summary: Wrong shortcuts/tooltips for Comment buttons

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2416].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Page automatically scrolls to the bottom when grabbing a field to re-arrange the order.
This happens on every movement so if the list is longer than the height of the screen, it is very hard to move things up the list.

h3. Environment
* Google Chrome. Tested happening on Versions 43.0.2357.132, 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit)
* Browser Window height < ~600px (or long Fields list)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the Window of your browser to a reduced height of about ~500px
# As anAgent go to a Service Desk Project Request Types admin section
# Click on Edit Fields of a Request Type
# Without being at the bottom of the page, grab a field
# Move the field at least 1 pixel in any direction

*Expected Results:*
Field is selected and page doesn't scroll. Field can be moved around without the page scrolling unless the mouse is at the furthest of the page

*Actual Results:*
The page scrolls to the bottom of the page on every movement.

h3.Workaround
* Use a different web browser
* increase the window size or sreen resolution if possible
fields.summary: Request Type Fields section automatically scrolls to the bottom when arranging fields

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-2415].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Since Service Desk view and JIRA project view were merged, the link to Reports only shows Service Desk reports, while JIRA default reports are missing.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Service Desk project
 # Click *Reports*

h3. Expected Results

Service Desk and JIRA default reports should be shown
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2015-10-12 at 5.40.13 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Add the link below to *Project Shortcuts*:
 [https://your_instance.atlassian.net/projects/your_project_key/?selectedItem=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:report-page]
fields.summary: Consider making possible to view JIRA Core reports in a Service Desk project type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center
